basics.name: Rudhra Raveendran
basics.label: Programmer. Designer. Creator.
basics.summary: I am a senior at Lincoln Sudbury Regional High School, and I love Computer Science. I have been programming for over four years, over which I have picked up a variety of languages and skills. Currently, I work as a software developer for Provender, focusing on front end applications while occasionally contributing to the main Ruby on Rails application. Outside of work I frequently spend time on a wide range of personal projects (programming and otherwise), as well as participate in local hackathons.

work.summary: Provender is an online market place that serves as a direct connection between dozens of local farmers and high quality restaurants. A brand new way of going from farm to fork.

awards.title: First Place at the MIT Blueprint 2016 Hackathon
awards.summary: My team's project, CV-Pong, was a variation on the game of pong where the game is played in a 3D space as opposed to a 2D one. Players' perspectives are behind their paddle, which can move along both the X and Y axis. Players control their paddles with their webcam, as the project uses OpenCV to track objects that the in game paddle follows. (For demonstration at Blueprint we used a bright blue glove)

awards.title: First Place at the HackExeter Spring 2015 Hackathon
awards.summary: My team's project, G-Pong, was a variation on the game of pong where players control a gravity well that influences the ball, rather than controlling a paddle. The game can be played by two players on separate machines, and others who join the game are able to spectate the match in progress.

awards.title: Second Place at the LexHack 2015 Hackathon
awards.summary: My team's project, SquadUp, was an attempt to solve a problem our friend group faced constantly. We would try to organize a group event, but the Facebook chat used for that purpose would quickly get off track and out of hand, so for LexHack we made a webapp that focused just on the place and time of events, and allowed people to RSVP to the event and track those on their way through Google Maps.
